adjectives.description: kitish (comparative more kitish, superlative most kitish)

entries.meaning: Resembling or pertaining to a kite (the bird of prey).
examples: Even then, Wingfield endeavoured to retain the hawk by the substitution of another — young Kate, as he called her, a wild, raking bird as ever flew, whose kitish propensities had, some time before, led him to give her up as irreclaimable.
